Tables

Table TT-UI.Table

Example implementation and documentation of Table component can be found from the Git repository.

Simple Table

 

Description

Simple table design differs visually from the complex table by using the light grey - white background colouring for separating between the rows.

Usage

  • Use for representing static information (comparison view, list of values...)
  • Use for a table which has simple interaction of opening more details for the selected row in another page or a modal window.

Rules and recommendations

  • Use light grey - white background colouring to differentiate rows from each other.
  • Avoid using additional horizontal separator lines.
  • Avoid using vertical dividers, instead align and group table content clearly.

Complex Table

 

Description

Complex table design differs visually from the simple table by using horizontal lines as a separator between the rows in the collapsed view and there is an expansion arrow at the end of the row.

Usage

  • Use especially when it is valuable to display e.g. total / summary values in the primary level of the table and then provide drill down details on expansion.
  • Use also when additional information is so less that additional page is unnecessary. (Remember to use consistent design across the system.)

Rules and recommendations

  • Use light narrow horizontal line to separate rows from each other.
  • Use expansion - collapsing arrow at the end of the row.
  • When row is expanded to display the preview / more content for the item, ensure that content is visually tight together so that user cannot mix the content to the other rows in the table.
  • Do not add several levels of expansions. One expansion should be maximum.
  • Avoid using vertical dividers, instead align and group table content clearly.

Actions in Table

 

Description

Table can have actions for single rows and multiple selected rows. Single row actions are available at the end of the row and action buttons for multiple selection appear above the table as soon as user selects one item / row.

Usage

  • Keep the amount of single actions limited.
  • Use shared actions for cases when a bulk action is required, like deletion.
  • Avoid adding separate action for viewing the item, instead make the row open the details instead.
  • If row has both actions: viewing details on clicking on row and check box selection, then click on row will both select and display the viewing. And click on checkbox directly will only select (not display viewing).

Rules and recommendations

  • Bulk action buttons should appear only when row item has been selected (buttons are not be visible all the time).
  • The selected row(s) should have a light highlight for easy discover.

 

Data alignment in Tables

 

Description

Depending on the data value the alignment should differ. Alignment should either be left, centred, or right. Considered for left to right UIs. If UI mirrored then the alignment to be opposite.

Usage

  • Use left alignment for names, IDs, descriptions and text.
  • Use centre alignment for dates and icons.
  • Use right alignment for amounts and monetary values.

Rules and recommendations

  • Ensure to use alignments consistently across the system.
